column4: i need network manager to run a startup script with root privileges, can i do this?
you can call scripts on startup from /etc/rc.local and they will run with root privaleges

that's not really helpful. It's a script that has to run at network up, not startup. I can make the script run using networkmanager, but i need it to be able to change my routing tables, which it cannot
ahh, I misunderstood, I thought you meant machine startup.  I generally just have a script I call manually to set up my network/routing tables (not helpful I know).
